intro: Triumfetta mastersii var. deschampsii, commonly known as the desert glorybower, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are usually small, ovate, and covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss. The species is well adapted to drought conditions and is often found in rocky soils and along riverbanks.
